verses.text_plain: The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.
verses.verse_html: 1The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

verses.text_plain: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.
verses.verse_html:
2Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine. ▼
▼ thy…: Heb. thy loves

footnotes.body_html: ▼ thy…: Heb. thy loves

verses.text_plain: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.
verses.verse_html: 3Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

verses.text_plain: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
verses.verse_html:
4Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee. ▼
▼ the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly

verses.text_plain: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
verses.verse_html: 5I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

verses.text_plain: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.
verses.verse_html: 6Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.

verses.text_plain: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
verses.verse_html:
7Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions? ▼
▼ as one…: or, as one that is veiled

tokens.text: me, O thou whom my soul
why should I be as one that turneth aside

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as one…: or, as one that is veiled
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as one…: or, as one that is veiled

verses.text_plain: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
verses.verse_html: 8If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

verses.text_plain: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.
verses.verse_html: 9I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

verses.text_plain: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.
verses.verse_html: 10Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.

verses.text_plain: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
verses.verse_html: 11We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

verses.text_plain: While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
verses.verse_html: 12While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

verses.text_plain: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
verses.verse_html: 13A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

verses.text_plain: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En–gedi.
verses.verse_html:
14My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En–gedi. ▼
▼ camphire: or, cypress

verses.text_plain: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes.
verses.verse_html:
15Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes. ▼
▼ my love: or, my companion

footnotes.body_html: ▼ my love: or, my companion

verses.text_plain: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.
verses.verse_html: 16Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.

verses.text_plain: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
verses.verse_html:
17The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir. ▼
▼ rafters: or, galleries
